document.masterDocTitle: The checklist of longhorn beetles (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae) from India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The checklist of longhorn beetles (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae) from India

subSubSection.paragraph:
1.
Rosalia ( Eurybatus ) decempunctata
( Westwood, 1848 )

Rosalia ( Eurybatus ) decempunctata
subsp. insulana Kriesche, 1920 : 112
.

Rosalia ( Eurybatus ) decempunctata
subsp. orientalis Kriesche, 1920 : 111
.

Type locality:
Vietnam : Tonkin (ST ‚ôÇ & ‚ôÄ ); ZMB
.

Rosalia ( Eurybatus ) decempunctata
Gressitt & Rondon, 1970 : 190, fig. 32d (Fauna).

Distribution: India ( Assam ; WB: Darjeeling, Pedong; Sikkim ; Tripura ; Himalaya; AR: Namdapha), Bangladsh: Silhet; Java , Borneo, Laos ( Tonkin ), China : Hubei , Taiwan , Guangdong , Hainan , Guangxi , Guizhou , Yunnan , Xizang ; Indonesia & Vietnam ( Gia Lai ).

2.

(Eurybatus) formosa ( Saunders, 1839 )

formosus

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: India (Himalaya; Utrar Pradesh: Barrackpore; WB: Darjeeling, Pedong; Sikkim ; Assam : Khasi Hilles; Indian Orientalis ; AR: Namdapha), China : Taiwan ; Xizang ; Laos & Nepal .

3.
Rosalia ( Eurybatus ) gravida
Lameere, 1887

Rosalia ( Eurybatus ) gravida
Lameere, 1887 : 162, 166, pl. III, fig. 4; Gahan, 1906 : 178 (Fauna); Vuillet, 1911c : 217, Vuillet, 1911a : 81; Takakuwa, 1998 : 84, pl. 23, figs 18-1‚Äì5 ; fig. 16; Mitra et al., 2015: 5 (Distr.).

Type locality:
India : India Orientalis ( Himalaya ), Darjeeling (HT ‚ôÄ ); MNHNP
.
Rosalia gravida Boppe, 1911 : 106 (Key); Hua, 2002 : 231 (Cat., m. s.).
Distribution: India (Himalaya; Sikkim ; WB: Darjeeling; Assam ), Turcmenia, Kara-Kum W√ºste, Former USSR & China : Xizang .

4.

(Thomson, 1861)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

(n. n.); Thomson, 1861: 250;
Thomson, 1864 : 261
; Lameere, 1890 (Distr.).

subSubSection.paragraph: Rosalia hariola Boppe, 1911 : 106 (Key); Weigel, 2006 : 499 (Distr.).

Type locality:
Nepal : Central Nepal , Bogara-Dobang (HT ‚ôÇ ); ELKU .
Distribution: India ( Sikkim ; WB: Calcutta, Darjeeling, Pedong; Himalaya), Central Nepal , Thimphu & Tatopani.
